medical_history.chief_complaint: Aseptic meningitis during eradication therapy for Helicobacter pylori.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began within 2 hours of taking a combination therapy of lansoprazole, amoxicillin, and metronidazole. The patient experienced headache, nausea, photophobia, and neck stiffness. Symptoms resolved spontaneously after stopping the therapy and recurred upon restarting the drugs, resolving again after discontinuation. This pattern repeated when the patient resumed therapy with a different antibiotic, clarithromycin.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with viral meningitis on two previous occasions in 1991; history of migraine since age 14 years, controlled without prophylactic medication. Previous use of metronidazole in 1996 without ill effects.
